---
title: Variations among Students’ Experiences of Learning to Counsel
type: pub
encoding: UTF-8

---
<h1>Publikasjon</h1>
<article id="csl-bib-container-ZT9MMQFB" class="csl-bib-container">
  <div class="csl-bib-body"> <div class="csl-entry">Paulsen, M. K., &#38; Aubert, A.-M. (2019). Variations among Students’ Experiences of Learning to Counsel. <i>Nordisk Tidsskrift i Veiledningspedagogikk</i>, <i>4</i>(1), 35–49. <a href="https://doi.org/10.15845/ntvp.v4i1.1497">https://doi.org/10.15845/ntvp.v4i1.1497</a></div> </div>

<div id="csl-bib-meta-ZT9MMQFB" class="csl-bib-meta">
  <article id="about-article-ZT9MMQFB" class="about_pub-article">
    <h1>Om</h1>
    Paulsen og Aubert gjennomførte ein studie for å forstå korleis studentar opplever læring i eit deltids, toårig rådgjevingskurs. Dei nytta ein metode der deltakarane delte sine erfaringar, og identifiserte tre hovudfaktorar. Den første faktoren framheva viktigheita av å byggje effektive rådgjevingsrelasjonar. Den andre faktoren understreka den overordna strukturen og innhaldet i kurset. Den tredje faktoren fokuserte på personleg sjølvutvikling. Desse funna er viktige fordi dei kan hjelpe studentar og lærarar å kjenne att sentrale aspekt ved rådgjevarutvikling. I tillegg gir studien innsikt i korleis ein kan utforme og implementere ein læreplan for deltids rådgjevingskurs, og gjere den meir effektiv for framtidige lærande.
  </article>
  <article id="keywords-article-ZT9MMQFB" class="keywords-article">
    <h1>Emneord</h1>
    Rådgjevingskurs, Studentar sine erfaringar, Profesjonell utvikling, Deltidsutdanning, Læreplanimplementering
  </article>
  <article id="abstract-article-ZT9MMQFB" class="abstract-article">
    <h1>Samandrag</h1>
    We explored students’ experiences of learning in a part-time, two-year counseling course (60 European Credit Transfer and Accumulation System [ECTS] credits). We wanted to know if there were any systematic variations among individual experiences — if so, what kinds of patterns characterized the variations and how to understand the patterns. We applied the Q method, in which 22 out of 23 participants shared their experiences. Our key findings emerged in three factors. We interpreted and named them F1: building effective counseling relationships is fundamental, F2: the entirety of the course, and F3: self-development. We discuss the factors from theory of counselors’ professional development. The knowledge may support students and teachers in their awareness of what is the important aspects of counselor development. From a subject-didactic perspective, the study informs readers on how to implement a curriculum for a part-time counseling course.
  </article>
